page.title: 09MUSEUMS IN SHEFFIELD
page.content: {Kelham Island Industrial Museum,} situated in a building originally built in 1897 to generate electricity for Sheffield's trams, was opened in 1982. It has been developed to show not only the diversity of products made in Sheffield but also to show with exhibits - a variety of tableaux, audio-slide displays and films - the story of Sheffield's industrial development. The most impressive exhibit is the {'River Don Engine',}a huge, working steam engine typical of those used to drive the rolling mills in the east of the city. An unusual feature is the inclusion of workshops where three{'Little {Mesters'}(a local term for steel craftsmen) can be observed producing some of the specialised products for which Sheffield has become famous.
